http://deepanddown.livejournal.com/77657.html

So, I promised pictures of the new little.



These are the two babies. The one on the left is the new little. His name is Moe. The one on the right is our baby Rex. They look like they could almost be brothers! And they've only been around each other for a little more than a week, and they already love each other! They're so cute. 
I'm sure more pictures of the cuties will be coming soon, but I must end the entry now. Little Moe is sleeping on my chair right now, so I don't have much room and I'm not comfy. 
Oh, but before I go, my sister and my mom are coming to visit on Friday! I'm so excited!!!!!

-Stephanie

Ashley and I decided we need to update more often. And you (yes, you!) should, too. I like having lots of good stuff to read. Good, juicy stuff. So make it up if you have to. (:

Good/Bad/WTF?!? List in true Altie Style

Good: 
* knitting, yes, knitting. Lots and lots of knitting. I'm working on Christmas presents right now. Scarves, and hats, and mittens, oh my!
* The Superficial (Thanks, Ashley!)
* Kitty! I love him to death.
* Weddings. I found my DJ!
* PBS. We don't have cable, but we do have four PBS channels. I love me some create.
* Halloween, which means candy corn! I looooove candy corn.
* Orange soda. Mmmmmmmmm
* Dishwashers, even if they're portable. I hate washing dishes.
* Strawberry water.
* Coupons!!!!

Bad:
* Ripping apart a room in the house. 
* Said room contained the thermostat and it had to be removed, so no AC.
* TOO HOT! Can someone tell Mr. Weather that it's September?
* My hand cramping when I was knitting earlier today.
* Gas costs a lot of money.
* I miss Minnesota.
* No cash money. ):
* ITS TOO HOT!!!!
* Lots of wedding stuff to plan, not enough time.
* Needing to buy a wedding dress.

WTF?!?:
* Why is it so hot?!
* Why are weddings so damn expensive?
* Plaster. Plaster is a bitch.
* Have I said yet that it's too hot?

Okay, it's taken me far too long to write this, so....
Peace out!
-Stephanie

LiveJournal has reminded me that it's been eight weeks since I last updated. Ooops. So, here we go.
Sam and I are back in Illinois and (sort of) settled into our house. It's really great to have a whole house to mess up and hang around in. The cat loves it! I'll put up some pictures sometime.
I'm back at Illinois State this fall. It's going pretty well so far. My class are all pretty interesting so far, but the reading is slightly outrageous for my politics class. Five novels?? Seriously??? And my teacher for that class tries to dress super trendy. However, he doesn't understand French cuffs. Oh well.
The wedding is coming up in 281 days, according to my countdown.  I have a dress that I really like, but I'm going to go dress shopping some more with Erin soon. I also have to get all those crazy ladies to look at bridesmaid dresses. I've also been looking for stuff to make the centerpeices with, but I'm not finding much. If you know of anywhere to get cheap fishbowls/vases or those little marble things, let me know. 
I think that's good for now. I have to go and make a classroom layout plan for class. Hooray for not having class until eleven!

Peace out.

I said I'd update more often, but I haven't. Oh well. Seriously, what do you expect from me??

It's been getting super-duper warm outside over the past few days and it makes me super happy. Currently, it's 43 degrees. I walked around today without my coat on. How amazing!

There isn't really a whole lot going on in my life, as usual. I went down to Illinois last weekend. I spend Friday night/Saturday morning with Erin in Pekin and then went to Bloomington on Saturday/Sunday morning and stayed with Anna. I had a ton of fun in both towns and it was great getting a chance to catch up with everyone. I sent a Valentine's Day card to Rachael and Katie and Katie sent me a super sweet letter with some pictures. It made me very happy. I love hearing from my friends. (HINT HINT, that probably means you!)

School has been going pretty well. I'm president of the Geology Club now and it's kinda stressful because we have stuff coming up that hasn't been fully planned. Oh well. Also, I still don't have a placement for observing. My teacher said she can't find anywhere because I need to be available more times during the day. I have three hours open on three different days! How is that not enough time?! Whatever. I'm just kinda stressed because I need 20 observation hours and I'm not sure I'll be able to get it done. 

My mom and my sister are coming to visit this weekend. I'm excited, but mostly because my mom will buy me lots of stuff. I need new nice clothes for work and teaching. And I just need stuff, or rather, I just want stuff. And my mom hasn't seen our new apartment yet (I know, it's been almost a year!).

Well, that's it for now...

-Stephanie

I was just writing about finals when the cat jumped on my computer and deleted the whole thing. Dammit!

I'll just keep it short for this one. I have two tests I'm worried about, one today and one tomorrow. I have no tests on Wednesday or Friday, which rocks. And my latest test is today at 2. So, all in all, not that bad.

I'm going home next Monday. Sunday is my last day at JCPenney (yes!). I can't wait to go home and see my mom! It's been forever since I saw her because she was working out of town the last time I was home. And I'll hopefully get to see Rachael and Anna and everyone else. I'm going to miss Sam and my kitty, too, though. ): We're doing Christmas with my dad's side of the family on Friday the 22nd, and then I'm coming back down to Ames on Saturday so that Sam and I can go down to Decatur. We're bringing the kitty with us, so that should be an adventure. I might bring the leash with so he can go outside for a little bit on the way. That reminds me that I have to clean out my car... Danny said we could keep Rex at his house. I hope he didn't change his mind... 

Well, it's almost time to head off to take my first final. Wish me luck.

Good luck to everyone else who has finals this week!!

-Stephanie

http://deepanddown.livejournal.com/73244.html

It's Friday and I don't even have anything to look forward to. Three classes, Geology Club meeting, then work. Such an exciting life I lead...

And speaking of classes, they're all going pretty well. I'm going to give an overview of them now so I can see how different I feel about them at the end of the semester.

Religion 205-Introduction to World Religions: I like this class a lot. The teacher is really cool and really laid back and we don't really have many assignments. Not a whole lot of reading, either, so I'm all about that. The teacher spends most of the class telling us stories about his family, like how he and his wife got married in Vegas by an Elvis impersonator(totally true, we saw pictures), and I enjoy that. 

Geology 100-The earth: Mostly stuff I already know. You can tell this class was designed for Freshmen because it reminds me of high school. I'm not worried about this class at all. But the teacher is nice and she tries to make it interesting.

Geology 100L-The Earth Lab: They shouldn't even call it a lab. We have yet to do anything lab related. It's two hours at night (7-9) and we just sit there and work on problems out of the lab book after our TA tries to explain stuff to us. Of course, we don't understand her because she's nervous as hell and doesn't speak English that well. At least she's trying, I guess.

Curriculum and Instruction 204-Social Foundations of American Education: Gripe #1: the name of the class is too long. But I guess that's it. The material is kind of boring (it's basically the history of Education in America) and I want to nominate the teacher for What Not to Wear. It's the longest hour and fifteen minutes of my day.

Astronomy 150-Stars, Galaxies, and Cosmology: I read an article last year about my teacher for this class and how he wanted to teach an Intelligent Design class here, so I was a little worried about how he would teach, but other than lame jokes, he's fine. The class sucks. We have yet to learn about anything astronomy related, just physics and chemistry type stuff. I just keep telling myself that it will get better.

Geology 311-Mineralogy: The teacher for this class is my advisor and when I first met him, I thought he was mean, but he's totally not. He's a nice guy with big glasses that make his eyes look huge. He makes me laugh, though. This is probably going to be my toughest class, but I have confidence. Plus, all of the other students are really nice and I know they'll help out if I need it.

Geology 311L-Mineralogy and Optical Mineralogy Lab: These two labs aren't that bad. One is hand identification and the other is working with microscopes. The microscopes give me a headache, but I guess that's just an occupational hazard. 

So, that's basically it. My 18 credits. School's going alright so far. I have some trips planned on weekends (going home on the 16th maybe, going to Bloomington the 29th, and Jon and Allie's wedding on the 7th!!) that I'm very excited about. I've also been a reading machine, so I'm feeling pretty positive about that, too. I need to write letters and send them out, but I'm lazy. I'm trying, I promise!

Time to get ready for class.
-Stephanie

i carry your heart with me(i carry it in
my heart)i am never without it(anywhere
i go you go,my dear; and whatever is done
by only me is your doing,my darling)
                                    i fear
no fate(for you are my fate,my sweet)i want
no world(for beautiful you are my world,my true)
and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant
and whatever a sun will always sing is you

here is the deepest secret nobody knows
(here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud
and the sky of the sky of a tree called life;which grows
higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide)
and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart

i carry your heart(i carry it in my heart)

Oh my god. I just made a big, long post with pictures about moving into the apartment. THEN I LOST IT!!! AHHH!!!

Start over.

Type your cut contents here.

Bedroom, view from the door. I'm messy.


Bedroom, view from the window. Closet and the BATCAVE!!!!


View from inside the batcave (aka, the storage room).


Some of the stuff inside the batcave. Not really important.


Living room. My parents bought us furnature!!!


Living room, with a view of the deck, from the kitchen.


The office. Where I'm currently sitting. The bed won't always be there, but I'm just too lazy to uninflate it.


The bathroom. Or, part of the bathroom. And yes, that is a world map shower curtain.


The kitchen. The table is very messy. Erin bought us US map placemats.


The corner of the balcony, with my sad plants.


The view from the balcony, the parking lot. Bonus points if you can find my car!

I like being here, but it's very lonely. I can't wait until Sam gets here.
Oh, and the smoke detector is VERY sensitive. Every time I've used the oven, it goes off! I tried making cookies last night, but stopped after one batch because it went off! And then, it went off again today when I was making mini corn dogs. I also decided that when I have a house of my own, I'm getting a gas oven. No electric for me. I don't like having the bottom of everything burned to a crisp while the rest is not done. Oh well. I guess I'll just make do with the toaster oven.

So, that's it. There's the lovely new apartment. Visitors are always welcome! 

Stephanie

50 of the MOST random questions ever...

1. Where were you 1 hour ago? 
At 10:27 am, I was sitting in calc staring at my quiz.

2. When is the last time you filled up your gas tank?
The last time I filled it up? I think it was In Davenport-ish on my way home from Decatur. My dad filled it up last weekend for me.

3. What is the most amount of money you spent in one store?
I don't know. I tend to spend a lot of money online. I don't know the last time I spent more than $50 on myself at any store. 

4. Is there anything pink within 10 feet of you?
Do you know who you're asking?! I'm wearing a pink sweatshirt, there's a pink cup on my desk, a pink heart photo album (from Erin's mom for V-Day last year), my piggy bank, more photo albums, a pink basket, pink Hello Kitty band-aids, etc... 

5. When is the last time you went to the mall?
I was at the mall last Sunday for work. I'm going back later tonight. 

6. Are you wearing socks right now?
Of course. The only time I don't wear socks is in bed. Or in the shower, I guess.

7. Do you have a car worth over $5,000?
It was purchased for over $5,000. I don't know if it's still worth that. I would hope so.

8. When was the last time you drove out of town?
I drove down to Decatur two weekends ago-ish, then back.

9. Have you been to the movies in the last 5 days?
I don't remember when the last time I went to the movies was. I want to go see Ice Age 2, maybe this weekend! The last movie I saw was "Hello Sister, Goodbye Life" on ABC Family last night. 

11. What was the last thing you had to drink?
Mountain Dew. 

12. What was the last thing you mailed in the mail?
Speeding ticket. :X 

13. Do you wash you car?
My car usually gets washed when I get the oil changed, but only if it's free. Otherwise, the rain washes it for me, duh.

14. Last fast food you ate?
I had a Cinnamon Toast Crunch cereal bar for breakfast.

15. Where were you last week today?
Exactly where I am now. Just got out of class, about to eat lunch. 

16. Have you bought any clothing items in the last week?
Negative.

18. Do you own any land?
I own some plants? Is that sort of the same?

19. What do you want to be when you "grow up"?
I'm going to be a teacher!

20. Your dream vacation?
Somewhere that there's enough stuff to do, but isn't super tourist-y. I really want to go to Canada at some point in my life. 

21. Last boat ride you went on?
It was the Fourth of July two or maybe three years ago, with Nikki, Wendy, and Eric and his family.

22. How old are your parents?
My dad is 44 and my mom is 43, I think. Maybe it's 45 and 44, I don't know.

23. Are you in love?
I'm madly in love!

24. Do you have any single friends?
I don't have many friends, but I do have some single friends.

25. Last play you saw?
I'm sure it was something in High School. I have no idea.

26. Have you been to New York?
No, and to be honest, I'd be a little scared to go. 

27. What are your plans for tonight?
Work until 10, hopefully catching the rerun of the new What Not to Wear. That's about it.

28. Last concert you went to?
Jason Mraz, I think. Too long ago!

29. Next trip you are going to take?
I have to go home at some point.

30. Ever go to camp?
No, and I think I'm glad I didn't.

31. Were you an honor roll student in school?
Indeed I was. 

32. What is your current GPA?
2.something-ish

33. Are you wearing any perfume or cologne?
Yep, Marc Jacobs. 

34. Are you hungry?
Yes. And I have the hiccups. 

35. Where is your best friend located?
Decatur, Illinois. 

36. Do you own a cowboy hat?
No, and I'm really glad I don't. 

37. Do you have a tan?
I'm the palest kid around.

38. How old do you want to be when you have kids?
I would like to be in my mid 20s.

39. Do you collect anything?
State quarters? I don't think so.

40. Is this quiz annoying?
Not as annoying as the DAB. 

41. Last time you got pulled over?
On my way down to Illinois the last time I went. 

42. Ever been arrested?
Nope.

43. Been to Mexico for Spring Break?
I don't think I'd want to go.

44. Do you like hot sauce?
I don't really like spicy things. 

45. Last time you drove somewhere?
I went to Target on Wednesday.

46. Do you need to do laundry?
I did laundry earlier this week, so I'm good.

47. How many friends do you have?
I've got enough. 

48. Are you someones best friend?
I certainly hope so!

49. Are you rich?
Me and my $7.50 an hour are real rich.

50. What are you thinking right this minute?
Fooooood!

Worst night of sleep ever. I woke up at around 11:24, about an hour after I fell asleep, extremely uncomfortable. I was hot, I couldn't breathe, my throat hurt, my shoulders hurt, and I just couldn't find a comfortable position. So I got up, turned on the AC and got some juice, then crawled back into bed. I woke up again sometime during the night because I had a horrible dream that involved Sam. I don't remember what it was now, but I woke up making the crying noise, but not actually crying. Then I finally woke up at 6:47, as I do on most mornings, and my entire body hurts. I'm either getting sick or have allergies, but either way I feel like crap. I have my advisor meeting today after physics and I register for classes tomorrow. Hopefully that all works out well and I get into all of my classes and my advisor doesn't tell me I'll be here for two more years than I thought. We'll see...

Stephanie

If I were a month, I'd be: I'm torn. I would be two. October and May. October because it's when my birthday is, and Halloween (and Rachael's birthday), and because it's just getting a little chilly and the trees are pretty colors and stuff. May because it's when it stops being so damn cold and everything gets pretty outside.

If I were a day in a week, I'd be: Saturday. Class is over, and I still have another day until class starts. Or Tuesday. Gilmore Girls, House, SVU, yes please!

If I were a time, I'd be: 10:22. am or pm, doesn't matter. It's my birthday in time! Or 12:08am, but I won't go into why.

If I were a planet, I'd be: URANUS!!!! Planet U!!! The disappearing moon, 1986u10!!!! The vertical rings!!! Watch out, it's coming from behind!!!

If I were a sea animal, I'd be: a manatee! Sea cows!

If I were a direction, I'd be: East, it's how I go to get to Sam.

If I were a piece of furniture, I'd be: One of those big oversized chairs that you can sit in all by yourself or snuggle with someone. (:

If I were a sin, I'd be: Wrath. Just because that's what Kahlen was in America's Next Top Model and I wanted her to win.

If I were a liquid, I'd be: Mountain Dew. So tasty, yet so terrible.

If I were a tree, I'd be: Sugar Maple? I adopted a tree in my yard one year because Nickelodeon told me to.

If I were a plant, I'd be: Some kind of pretty flower. Nothing cheesy like a rose, but something pretty.

If I were a state of weather, I'd be: TORNADO!!!!!

If I were a musical instrument, I'd be: Tambourine. One day, I want to be a bad ass tambourine player in a band.

If I were an animal, I'd be: Either a kitty or a cow. But probably a Lilo kitty, because she's spoiled and doesn't do anything all day.

If I were a color, I'd be: Pink. Or Green. Or maybe both?

If I were a vegetable, I'd be: Lettuce. When I was little, I used to eat it plain all the time. Who eats just lettuce???

If I were a sound, I'd be: the sound that a good rain makes on the roof and the windows. Very calming.

If I were an element, I'd be: Pb, lead. Peanut butter is heavy and so is lead. Thank you, Mr. Vander Hayden!

If I were a car, I'd be: Malibu. Okay, I really don't know any other car types.

If I were a song, I'd be: "New American Classic" by Taking Back Sunday. It's something you wouldn't expect from them and it's so pretty that it makes you want to cry.

If I were a movie, I'd be: Garden State, duh.

If I were a book, I'd be written by: Hmm, good one. Nick Hornby?

If I were food, I'd be: Chicken.

If I were a place, I'd be: Somewhere pretty. Warm, not too war, n ot too cold.

If I were a number, I'd be: 47

 

Journal entry in the form of a survey? Duh.
